This application is meant for taking simple notes when the need arises. To this end, it allows for an arbitrary number of notes to be created which can each in turn hold any number of text items. Items can also be made checkable in order to create to-do lists. To get started, add a note using the buttons below, or view an existing one. Then proceed to add items.

This view shows the selected note\'s manually-ordered list of items. Use the buttons below to navigate the list and add, (un)check, edit, or delete items. Tapping the selection button at the right “grabs” the selected icon and allows for it to be repositioned using the up/down arrow buttons on the touch screen. Tap the selection button again to revert to regular navigation mode.

string-array.name: welcome_note_items
string-array.item: This is a sample note with some items.
As you can see, nookNotes manages (an arbitrary number of) notes which are in turn made up of items.
Items can be added to, edited, deleted, and reordered using the options below.
Tap the right-most button below in order to switch to repositioning mode, in which you\'ll be able to move the selected item around using the adjacent up/down buttons.
Tap again to leave repositioning mode.
__UNCHECKED__ Items can also be made checkable and then be either unchecked (like this)...
Have a look at the “Tips & Tricks” note generated along with this one for further usage hints.
The “Help” button on the application\'s main menu will allow you to re-generate these introductory notes at any time, so it is safe to delete them after you read them.

string-array.name: tips_note_items
string-array.item: You can use the nook\'s physical buttons to switch pages, just as you would when reading a book. Left/right swipe gestures work, too, when the lower display is off.

Long-tap up/down arrows to jump to the top/bottom of the current page. This works in both the list of notes and when viewing an individual note, and even when reordering items. If the top-/bottom-most note/item is already selected when long-tapping the up/down arrow, respectively, the top-/bottom-most note/item on the previous/next page will be selected, which enables speedier paging (if done repeatedly).
Long-tap “Add item” to insert an item at the end of the list rather than be prompted to choose where to insert it.
Long-tap “Delete item” to delete without confirmation.
Adding items to a note which contains only checkable items will automatically make the new items checkable (but unchecked) as well.
Notes\' lists of items can be transformed in various ways: sorted, reversed, cleared. These options are available via the “Transform list” sub-menu in note view.
In order to have a list of items sorted both alphabetically and by check marks, sort alphabetically first and by check marks afterwards.

Limited markup in notes\' items can be enabled via the “Settings” menu. With the “Enable markup in items” option set, the following markup characters will format text surrounded by them: asterisks for bold, tildes for italics, underscores for underlined, hashes for a mono-space font. Literal markup characters can be created by placing two of them in succession.

Markup (if enabled) not explicitly terminated will extend to the end of an item\'s text. If you want to, e.g., make an entire item bold, you can thus simply start its text with an asterisk (and don\'t need a terminating one at the end).

You can have __APPNAME__ replace certain sequences of characters on input; replacements can be toggled in the “Settings” sub-menu of the main menu. “Replace umlauts on input” will replace transliterations of German umlauts, i.e., “Ae” → “Ä”, “ae” → “ä”, …, “sz” → “ß”. “Replace symbols on input” will perform the following replacements: “->” → “→”, “--” → “―”. If a replacement is unwanted in a given situation, press backspace once immediately after in order to revert it.
